instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1370: What is A1370? A1370 is a model number for a 11 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2010, Mid 2011 with EMC 2393, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2796, 820-3024..
definitions.820-3024: What is 820-3024? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Unable to read sensor [solved]
threads.message:
Hi

<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> came our service with liquid spill around SMC. Turning on with ac adapter but not start without ac adapter. I cleaned liquid and replaced some resistors looks like damaged. Now starting with out ac adapter and chargin battery not problem but few minutes later fan runs high and turn power of some times ( in 20 min. or 30 min) CPU and another chips not hot. ASD shows unable to read sensor like picture.

I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5510</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q5520</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q5530</TRANSISTOR> but nothing changed any idea for next step?

Thanks.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Unable to read sensor [solved]
threads.message: Please run the EFI version of ASD and report the missing sensor.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Unable to read sensor [solved]
threads.message: EFI version ASD shows " SMC to failed " error. I think we need replace SMC:(

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Unable to read sensor [solved]
threads.message: ASD will give an exact indication of the failing sensor(s). Please run EFI ASD and run a sensor test only

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1370</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3024</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Unable to read sensor [solved]
threads.message: Solved problem. ( some flux + hot air on SMC now working :)
